H0.text: Cools it is what happens to a surface when the evaporative loss of the most energetic water molecules occurs.

H1.text: Heats it is the result of the evaporative loss of the most energetic water molecules from a surface.

H2.text: Vents it is what happens to a surface when the evaporative loss of the most energetic water molecules occurs.

H3.text: Charges it is what the evaporative loss of the most energetic water molecules does to a surface.

A4.text: Evaporative cooling therefore causes a drop in the temperature of air proportional to the sensible heat drop

A5.text: The Apollo spacecraft used sublimators, compact and largely passive devices that dump waste heat in water vapor (steam) that is vented to space

A6.text: A swamp cooler cools air by evaporation

A7.text: When evaporation occurs, the energy removed from the vaporized liquid will reduce the temperature of the liquid, resulting in evaporative cooling.

A8.text: Evaporation is an endothermic process, since heat is absorbed during evaporation.
